intro: Phlomoides kansuensis, commonly known as the Kansu phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale blue or violet, arranged in whorls along the stem. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
